page.title: 17GRAVEL QUARRYING
page.content: { ROBERT BRETT AND SONS} The River Stour passing through our area has given rise to large gravel deposits in the Westbere Marshes area. Robert Brett founded the Sturry Quarrying business in 1945 when the area was all marshland. The land was drained and the gravel extracted. Originally 35 people were employed at the Sturry site but with increased mechanization that number has now been reduced to 14. The present works originally built in 1945 are at Sturry on the North side of the River. Gravel quarried on the South side of the river was transported by narrow-gauge railway to the works. Use of the railway ended in 1975 and it has now been dismantled. Gravel deposits at the Sturry site are exhausted but the plant is used for the manufacture of Durite from the gravel at Chartham.
